headerTagline: I CAN SOLVE RUBIK'S CUBE BLINDFOLDED

skills.popupDetailsText:
I have been programming since my freshman year in high school. My journey started with Python, and I quickly expanded to C++ for competitive programming. During the lockdown, I delved into web development with JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS. In college, I've furthered my skills in Java and Go.

You can find some of my recent projects on my GitHub: link:www.github.com/Vl4dk0.

Mathematics has always been a strong suit and a passion. I've consistently performed well in mathematical competitions and believe it provides a crucial foundation for logical thinking and problem-solving in computer science.

I studied English in school from the 2nd grade of primary school. I successfully completed my maturity exams (Maturita) with a result in the >85th percentile, achieving a B2 level of proficiency according to the CEFR.

education.popupDetailsText: Attended primary school in Strážske, where I developed foundational academic skills and first discovered my interest in logical puzzles and problem-solving.

During my time at Gymnasium P. Horova, I specialized in subjects that deepened my understanding of mathematics and informatics. This period was crucial for participating in various Olympiads and competitions, solidifying my passion for programming.

details: Faculty of Mathematics, Physics and Informatics
education.popupDetailsText: Currently pursuing a degree in Applied Informatics, where I am expanding my knowledge in various areas of computer science, including software development, algorithms, and data structures. I am actively engaging in challenging coursework and projects.

aboutMe: Highly motivated and adaptable informatics student with a strong foundation in programming and problem-solving, honed through years of competitive mathematics and informatics.

Seeking a challenging part-time or internship opportunity where I can contribute to innovative projects, further develop my technical skills, and learn from experienced professionals. Particularly interested in [mention specific areas like web development, backend systems, data science, etc. if you have preferences].

experience.popupDetailsText:
In SmartBase s.r.o I worked as a Junior developer on various projects s.a. <some websites>.

At first I only worked on frontend, html, css and javascript related tasks. But after first month I got to work on various tasks on backend as well. i.e. I worked on tasks s.a. integrating payment API or fixing bug with loading very high quality pictures when not necessary over mobile data.

I learned a lot and they were quite nice to me. But I unfortunately didn't have time to work enough hours because of school.

During the summer of 2020, I worked part-time at Azteka delivering pizzas.

This role helped me develop time management and customer service skills. It was a great way to understand local businesses and interact with a diverse range of people.

achievements.introText: Since the 5th grade of primary school I have regularly placed in the top positions in various mathematical competitions. Thanks to a good foundation in mathematics, I learned to program and solve algorithmic problems very quickly and easily, which is why I started to compete in programming as well.

subsections.title: My greatest accomplishments in high school:

items.summary: Qualifying for the national round of Math Olympiad
items.popupDetailsText: Qualifying for the national round of the Math Olympiad was a significant personal achievement. It involved months of preparation, tackling complex problems, and it was an honor to compete at that level. This experience greatly sharpened my analytical and problem-solving abilities.

items.summary: Obtaining 172 points at the KSP seminar (top 10 of 150+)
items.popupDetailsText: KSP (Korešpondenčný Seminár z Programovania) is a prestigious programming correspondence seminar. Securing a top 10 position among over 150 participants was a result of consistent effort in solving algorithmic challenges and coding solutions, primarily in C++.

Maintaining a 1.05 GPA in my initial semesters reflects my dedication to my studies and my ability to grasp complex concepts in informatics and mathematics quickly. (Note: In Slovakia, 1.0 is the best possible grade).
